metadata.Title: CVE-2020-28049 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in SDDM before 0.19.0. It incorrectly starts the Xserver in a way that - for a short time period - allows local unprivilegedusers to create a connection to the X server without providing properauthentication. A local attacker can thus access X server display contentsand, for example, intercept keystrokes or access the clipboard. This iscaused by a race condition during Xauthority file creation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-28049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sddm - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
sddm-theme-debian-elarun - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
sddm-theme-debian-maui - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
sddm-theme-elarun - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
sddm-theme-maldives - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
sddm-theme-maui - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
sddm-theme-maya - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sddm package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.19.0-2ubuntu1').
